SELECT u.id, u.username, u.email, COUNT(o.id) AS order_count, SUM(o.total_amount) AS total_spent, MAX(o.created_at) AS last_order_date FROM user u LEFT JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id WHERE u.status = 'ACTIVE' AND o.created_at >= #{startDate} AND o.created_at <= #{endDate} GROUP BY u.id, u.username, u.email HAVING COUNT(o.id) > 0 ORDER BY total_spent DESC, u.username ASC LIMIT #{pageSize} OFFSET #{offset}

SELECT id, username, email, 'ACTIVE' AS user_status FROM user WHERE status = 'ACTIVE' UNION ALL SELECT id, username, email, 'INACTIVE' AS user_status FROM user WHERE status = 'INACTIVE' AND last_login_at < CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL 90 DAY ORDER BY username

SELECT id, username, total_orders, CASE WHEN total_orders >= 100 THEN 'VIP' WHEN total_orders >= 50 THEN 'Gold' WHEN total_orders >= 10 THEN 'Silver' ELSE 'Bronze' END AS category FROM user WHERE status = 'ACTIVE'

SELECT id, username, NVL(email, 'no-email@example.com') AS email, TO_CHAR(created_at, 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS') AS created_at_str FROM user WHERE ROWNUM <= 10 AND status = #{status} ORDER BY created_at DESC
SELECT TOP 10 id, username, ISNULL(email, 'no-email@example.com') AS email, FORMAT(created_at, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss') AS created_at_str FROM [user] WHERE status = #{status} ORDER BY created_at DESC

SELECT id, username, total_orders, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY total_orders DESC) AS row_num, RANK() OVER (ORDER BY total_orders DESC) AS rank, DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY total_orders DESC) AS dense_rank, NTILE(4) OVER (ORDER BY total_orders DESC) AS quartile, LAG(username, 1) OVER (ORDER BY total_orders DESC) AS prev_user, LEAD(username, 1) OVER (ORDER BY total_orders DESC) AS next_user FROM user WHERE status = 'ACTIVE'

WITH active_users AS ( SELECT id, username, email, created_at FROM user WHERE status = 'ACTIVE' ), recent_users AS ( SELECT id, username, email, created_at FROM active_users WHERE created_at >= #{recentDate} ) SELECT ru.id, ru.username, ru.email, COUNT(o.id) AS order_count FROM recent_users ru LEFT JOIN orders o ON ru.id = o.user_id GROUP BY ru.id, ru.username, ru.email HAVING COUNT(o.id) > 0 ORDER BY order_count DESC
